metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12667 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Knot Resolver before 5.1.1 allows traffic amplification via a crafted DNS answer from an attacker-controlled server, aka an "NXNSAttack" issue. This is triggered by random subdomains in the NSDNAME in NS records.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-12667` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

knot-resolver - 5.1.1-0.1ubuntu1
knot-resolver-module-http - 5.1.1-0.1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: knot-resolver package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.1.1-0.1ubuntu1').
